statement.p: A surveyor starting from a point \displaystyle{A} moves N. 31°22′ E. a distance of 653′ 10.25″ to point \displaystyle{B}. Next, she moves N. 50°12′ E. a distance of 422′ 5.5″ to point \displaystyle{C}. Next, she walks S. 3°27′ W. a distance of 1622′ 7.75″ to point \displaystyle{D}. Finally, she returns to the starting point.
What distance must she walk to return to the starting point? (Answer accurate to the nearest quarter inch.)
What heading does she walk from the fourth point to return to the starting point? (Answer accurate to the nearest minute.)
What is the acreage of this plot of land?

p.em: Your answer should be accurate to 3 decimal places.

statement.p: the prime symbol in an angle represents minutes: 60′ = 1°
the prime symbol in a length represents feet; double prime = inches;
